title: Possible things Air dragon could give you:
body:
* No unit collision
* Bonus movespeed when moving towards allies
* Wards have more sight range
* Taking scuttle crab makes it stay in ward mode for longer
* Gain the ability to move through enemy base gates
* Cooldown reduction
* Shorter recall timers
* shorter teleport cooldown
* faster / longer lasting homeguards (that don't go away from in combat?) (that take less time when standing in fountain to activate?)
* speed up nearby minions
* casting time decrease
* slow duration / strength reduction (like swift boots)
* reduced death timers

replies.body: slow resist.
that sounds pretty viable
{{champion:22}} GOD DAMN IT PLEASE, I JUST GOT OUT OF THE SWIFTIES META
She needs more than just a metagame shift to help her stupidly weak base slow.
TBH I wish they didn't give ashe crit slows and just revert it to having a base slow that is somewhat relevant
Yeah, and only the base ms for the boots are being nerfed. The slow reduction is staying the same. So with boots and mastries for Tenacity/SlowReduction I don't think they should add Ten/Sr to air.

To be fair, we longer live in a world where people ONLY buy swifties if they didnt need the cdr boots, people MIGHT buy swifties if they dont want mercs, since ninja tabi are feeling pretty alright and cdr boots are nice for builds that dont weave a ton of cdr in there

Cast time decrease? Are you sure you would want that? Not only it is massive hidden power, it also has a snowbally effect on cast time champions: the Champions with low or zero cast times would be unnafected, while high cast times champions would get buffed.

Imagine Zed's Shadow being even faster, Ekko's W casting sooner or Caitlyn/Ezreal's ults going off faster. Woulnd't be really fun.
Not to mention it may make it harder to hit skillshots like Nami's bubble for example -- i aim it based on where i think they're going to move and the cast time of the skill etc...

Exactly. As a Soraka main, I got used to predicting where the enemies will be to land my Q. Reducing the cast time would make it harder to get used to.

How would I also land R seriously Soraka would get unplayable.

I believe Ekko's W is mostly delay rather than cast time.

By the way, Annie has a slight (maybe 0.35 seconds?) cast time on her Tibbers. :D Not that anyone would notice, but it would be buff to something people wanted even more delayed, lol.

Yeah, I checked again, Ekko's W has delay. My bad.

It would also make assassins have faster combos, and I'm sure no one wants that in their games.

Some of those effects are hard to implement using a 3-stack system without going into paragraphs of explanation. For example, how would you scale absolutes like "no unit collision" and "can walk through enemy base gates"?

But all those can be changed with numbers. Besides, the other parts for kass and fizz are lacklustre as hell
Reduced death timers? ;)
Distortion bonus? 5%, 7.5%, 10% CDR on Flash and Ghost?

> Gain the ability to move through enemy base gates

The gate was possibly created so that jungler doesn't need to take journey through Narnia to get to desired camp while still not allowing enemy to have this easy and unprotected access to the base. I think this shouldn't be thing of change from any item/mastery/buff...

> Taking scuttle crab makes it stay in ward mode for longer

I believe scuttle is not so important objective so it might end up being as only occasionally and partially useful as the current effect. And it may end up being hard to balance out.

> Cooldown reduction

Meddler thinks each class and subclass should have good access to CDR, now they'll be giving it to the classess with roster updates (Juggernauts may be partially included, mainly it got customized for Marksmen and Mages). So this may help early, but chances you get multiple (and kill) Cloud Drakes early in the game are small, plus it may end up being very useless for many champs in later phase of game.

However If it scaled well, I might see it as substitution for one or two CDR items that the player can now replace with for him more useful additional stats/passive/active. Question is whether this would not create unhealthy environment. Meddler said they are focusing on making the acess for CDR being tradeoff of something, If I remember correctly. This may create champs (ehm... {{champion:105}} ) who relied in their brokeness on some stat (CDR for frequent zhonyas) but had to trade off at least a little bursty dmg, now they'd might get 40%CDR with too much dmg to handle.

Even though hard to balance out, I think Item CDR might be more on point.

> Shorter recall timers

Good point, tho shorter death timers might be more appreciated nowadays, lol.

> casting time decrease

Again, this may be hard to balance out for entire roster and some champs might not even notice it.

> Bonus movespeed when moving towards allies
> slow duration / strength reduction (like swift boots)

If expanded not only for slows, tenacity is the word. Yeah, these two points are the best IMO, I'd echo them. +1 And I forgot that the ward thing is also good.

> Cooldown reduction

Yes

> Shorter recall timers

Absolutely

> Wards have more sight range

Yes please

I kind of like the current air dragon buff as a jungler; it makes ganking and engaging a bit easier. It also helps supports, assassins, melee champions and map mobility in general

CDR sounds great too. 5% per dragon + 15 ooc movespeed would be appealing.

Don't forget that Riot has said many times they want the air dragon to affect split pushing. Suggesting new ideas is awesome but they won't listen if they aren't what they're looking for. Speeding up nearby minions would affect split pushing, but anybody who wants to freeze a lane wouldn't want an air dragon. Nasus would literally beg his team to let the enemy get that air dragon.

Most of those are no-no's. Some are binary (unit-collision), some are balance problems (cast time decrease), and some are not universal enough (teleport). Only conditional movement speed (which we have already in a different form) and minion speed would be thing's they'd do.
